Documentation: Observer¶

Module: Observer¶

class Observer.Observer(name, elements)¶

Implement Observer object for Observer Pattern.

__init__(name, elements)¶
Parameters:
  • name – String. Label or name of current Observer.
  • elements – List. Elements to be observed by this Observer.
Returns:

None
__weakref__¶

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

update(obs, label, value)¶

Update observer.

Called when the observed object is modified. You call an Observable object’s C{notifyObserver} method to notify all the object’s observers of the change.

Parameters:
  • obs –

    ???

  • label – String. Name of updated data element.
  • value – New data value for label.
Returns:

None
class Observer.Observable¶

Implement Observable object for Observer Pattern.

__init__()¶

Initialize Observable object.

Set them to unchanged by default and synchronize them. Changed = 0 if unchanged.

notifyObservers(label, value, arg=None)¶

Notify all Observers that a change has occurred.

If ‘changed’ indicates that this object has changed, notify all its observers, then call clearChanged(). Each Observer has its update() called with two arguments: this Observable object and the generic ‘arg’.

Parameters:
  • label – String. Name of updated data element.
  • value – new data element.
  • arg – possible arguments for update().
Returns:

None
